result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin D Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 3 years confinement.
Consecutive to: with 65 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with any victim or co-actor named in the complaint.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Last 4 months at the day reporting center.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin D Wright

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING  Transcript (34 pages) commencing 05/28/2015 received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Tatyana M.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS with 65 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 3 years confinement.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  Court allows for dosage probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time, last 4 months at the day reporting center.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with any victim or co-actor named in the complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Devin D Wright in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Devin D Wright in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Armed Robbery, Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(2), 939.50(3)(c) and 939.05, a Class C Felony.

Defendant Devin D Wright in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Devin D Wright in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea and sentencing hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 05/20/2015 is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court, defendant Devin D Wright not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is returned back to Branch 22 at the request of the District Attorney and without objection from the parties or court.
Case in court for bail review.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES defense motion for bail reduction.  Defense requests final pre-trial and SPEEDY jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand. (SCHEDULING DATE HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY SCHEDULED WITH CO-DEFENDANT COUNSEL PRIOR TO THIS REQUEST.)
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Devin D Wright in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Defendant Devin D Wright in custody.  Ron Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Geoffrey McClendon-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling Conference April 28, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   No Contact with co-actors Calvin Marlow and Martavis Pugh.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  Case set for 4-07-15 at 8:30 a.m. for Preliminary Hearing  before Preliminary Hearing Court.

Defendant Devin D Wright in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Devin D Wright in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   The Court orders KEEP SEPARATE from co-actors Calvin D. Malone (dob 9-08-97) and Martavis W. Pugh (1-16-96).

ADDRESS INFO for Devin D Wright
Current: 7711 W. Hampton Ave #7, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 03-29-2015)
Prior: 8901 West Browndeer Road, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
